block.p: Caroline Jackson and Kyle Crafton were married yesterday at the Plymouth Church of the Pilgrims in Brooklyn. The Rev. David Fisher, a Congregational minister, performed the ceremony.
The couple graduated from Duke, where they met.
Caroline Jackson and Kyle Crafton were married yesterday at the Plymouth Church of the Pilgrims in Brooklyn. The Rev. David Fisher, a Congregational minister, performed the ceremony.
Caroline Jackson and Kyle Crafton were married yesterday at the Plymouth Church of the Pilgrims in Brooklyn. The Rev. David Fisher, a Congregational minister, performed the ceremony.
The couple graduated from Duke, where they met.

The bride, 30, is the deputy art director of Jane magazine in New York. She is a daughter of Robby Jackson and John R. Jackson of Paradise Valley, Ariz. Her father is an aerospace engineer and business development manager in Cypress, Calif., for DRS Technologies, which has its headquarters in Parsippany, N.J. Her mother is the director of scholarship administration for the Arizona State University Foundation in Tempe, which financially supports the university.

The bridegroom, 29, was until this month the publisher and chief financial officer of mediabistro.com, a Manhattan-based Web site providing news and career resources for people in the media. He is the son of Shirley Crafton and Robert Crafton of Homewood, Ill. His parents retired as teachers in Country Club Hills, Ill. His mother taught second grade at the Zenon J. Sykuta School and his father taught fifth and sixth grades at the Southwood School.
